intro: Crotalaria shevaroyensis, commonly known as the Shevaroy hill crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its erect, branching stems and alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces clusters of yellow, pea-like flowers, which are typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open forests. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
